chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis J Roethel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 54 days jail credit if probation is revoked

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay all court costs, supervision fees and any costs of treatment as a condition of probation.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Defendant to pay all court costs, supervision fees and any costs of treatment as a condition of probation.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08
Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.

timeConds.notes: may transfer to Sheboygan County if accepted by sheriff of both counties

Defendant Travis J Roethel in court with attorney Rachel Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Preliminary hearing waived. Conditions set by court:  Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. SCRAM before release.  No use or possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and in original containers.

Defendant Travis J Roethel in court with attorney Rachel Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Patti L Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail. Def does qualify for public defender.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Status conference scheduled for January 30, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
